title: Example 5.29 is adapted from Fryer and Greenman
Examples 5.30 and 5.33 are adapted from Leonard and Long. The model of a regulated monopolist was proposed by Averch and Johnson
The peak-load pricing problem has a long tradition in economics
It was ®rst formulated as an optimization problem by Williamson
Exercise 5.52 is based on Littlechild (1970), who applied peak-load pricing to a telephone network
This page intentionally left blank 6 Comparative Statics

note: discusses the implicit function approach to comparative statics in optimization models. 633 6.5 Notes
title: gives a thorough account of the traditional methods of comparative statics in economic analysis. Mas-Colell et al
are good expositions of the value function approach in the theory of the consumer and the producer
is also insightful
The monotonicity approach to comparative statics was introduced by Topkis
Its application to economics is still in its infancy
